seed_pair: 他想晚点和其他人一起回来。
He wants to come back with everyone else later on.

legos.teaches: Chinese uses he...yiqi (with...together) pattern for with someone

seed_pair: 她想知道答案是什么。
She wants to find out what the answer is.

legos.teaches: In embedded questions, Chinese keeps question word at the end: answer is what

seed_pair: 我们想今天晚上六点见面。
We want to meet at six o'clock this evening.

legos.teaches: This evening in Chinese is literally today evening

seed_pair: 但是我不想停止说话。
But I don't want to stop talking.

legos.teaches: negation particle 不 placed directly before verb

seed_pair: 你想快点学他的名字。
You want to learn his name quickly.

legos.teaches: possessive structure using 的 (de) particle between possessor and possessed

seed_pair: 你为什么在学她的名字？
Why are you learning her name?

legos.teaches: progressive aspect marker 在 placed before verb to indicate ongoing action
feminine possessive with 的 (de) particle

seed_pair: 因为我想认识会说中文的人。
Because I want to meet people who speak Mandarin Chinese.

legos.teaches: subject directly precedes 想 with no linking word
relative clauses with 的 come BEFORE the noun they modify

seed_pair: 我很快就要开始多说话了。
I am going to start talking more soon.

legos.teaches: 就要...了 expresses imminent future action
多 (more) goes BEFORE the verb in Chinese

seed_pair: 我不会轻易记住的。
I am not going to be able to remember easily.

lego.known: I am not going to be able to

legos.teaches: 不会 combines negation with future ability/possibility
住 as resultative complement indicates successful completion of action

seed_pair: 你要在我必须走之前帮我吗？
Are you going to help me before I have to go?

legos.teaches: 在...之前 structure for 'before' with clause inside

lego.known: Are you going to help me?

legos.teaches: 要 for future intention + 吗 question particle

seed_pair: 我喜欢感觉好像我快准备好走了。
I like feeling as if I am nearly ready to go.

legos.teaches: verb stacking: subject + verb1 + verb2

lego.known: I am nearly ready to go

legos.teaches: 快...了 structure for 'nearly/about to'

seed_pair: 我不喜欢花太多时间回答。
I do not like taking too much time to answer.

legos.teaches: 不 negation before verb
花 + amount + 时间 for spending time

seed_pair: 尽快开始说话是有用的。
It's useful to start talking as soon as you can.

legos.teaches: verb serialization - V1+V2 connect directly without linking words

seed_pair: 我期待尽快能说得更好。
I'm looking forward to speaking better as soon as I can.

legos.teaches: 得 (de) particle links verb to degree/manner complement

seed_pair: 昨天我想问你一件事。
I wanted to ask you something yesterday.

legos.teaches: S+想+V+O structure - 想 expresses past desire without tense markers, time word (昨天) at sentence start

seed_pair: 你今晚想跟我说话。
You wanted to speak with me tonight.

legos.teaches: In Mandarin, with-phrase (跟我) precedes the verb, not follows it

seed_pair: 你想给我看点什么吗？
Did you want to show me something?

legos.teaches: To show someone uses 给+person+看 structure (literally give-person-look)
Yes/no questions formed by adding 吗 particle at sentence end

seed_pair: 你学中文多长时间了？
How long have you been learning Mandarin Chinese?

legos.teaches: Duration questions use 多长时间 (how-much + long + time)

seed_pair: 别人在这里的时候，他不想保持安静。
He doesn't want to be quiet when other people are here.

legos.teaches: 的时候 pattern for temporal when clauses; subject + 在 + location + 的时候 structure

seed_pair: 她今天下午不想读任何东西。
She doesn't want to read anything this afternoon.
我们不想打断故事。
We don't want to interrupt the story.
上个月我开始仔细考虑这件事。
I started to think about it carefully last month.

legos.teaches: Time expressions use 上 (previous) + measure word + time unit
Subject directly precedes verb in Chinese
Demonstrative + measure word 件 + noun for abstract things

seed_pair: 我已经学了大约一个星期。
I have been learning for about a week.

lego.known: I have already; I have been

legos.teaches: 已经 marks completed or ongoing action up to now
了 after verb indicates completed action or change of state
Duration uses number + measure word 个 + time unit

seed_pair: 但是今天早上我有点累。
But I am a little tired this morning.

legos.teaches: Time expressions: larger unit (day) precedes smaller unit (part of day)
有点 before adjective expresses slight degree, often with negative connotation

seed_pair: 你现在感觉怎么样？
How do you feel at the moment?

legos.teaches: Chinese question structure: subject + verb + question word (opposite of English)

seed_pair: 我感觉还好，但是我开始感觉累了。
I feel okay, but I am starting to feel tired.

lego.known: I am starting to feel tired

legos.teaches: Sentence-final 了 indicates change of state (becoming tired)

seed_pair: 我开始感觉比昨晚好了。
I was starting to feel better than last night.

legos.teaches: Comparative structure: 比 + comparison object + adjective (not more good than)

seed_pair: 我没有在想怎么回答。
I wasn't thinking about how to answer.

legos.teaches: Progressive aspect marker 在 placed before verb

seed_pair: 或者如果我需要改进。
Or if I need to improve.
我不需要知道一切。
I don't need to know everything.
你能再说慢一点吗？
Could you say that again a little more slowly?

legos.teaches: 一点 follows adjective as degree modifier meaning 'a little more'
Polite request pattern: 你能 + verb + 吗？

seed_pair: 我不确定我能不能同时帮你。
I'm not sure if I can help you at the same time.

legos.teaches: 不 precedes verbs/adjectives for negation

lego.known: if I can / whether I can

legos.teaches: A-not-A pattern (能不能) embeds 'whether/if' meaning in statements

seed_pair: 你确定你不介意帮我吗？
Are you sure you don't mind helping me?

legos.teaches: 不 + verb for negative statements

seed_pair: 学中文不容易，但是很有趣。
Learning Mandarin Chinese isn't easy but it is fun.

lego.known: Learning Chinese isn't easy but it is fun.
lego.target: 学中文不容易，但是很有趣。

legos.teaches: Topic-comment structure: verb+object first, then adjective predicate; 很 intensifier before 有趣

seed_pair: 花时间测试自己很重要。
It's important to take time to test yourself.

lego.known: to take time / to spend time
It's important to take time to test yourself.
lego.target: 花时间测试自己很重要。

legos.teaches: Subject clause comes first (花时间测试自己), then predicate (很重要); no it placeholder in Chinese

seed_pair: 找到答案不难。
It's not difficult to find the answer.

lego.known: It's not difficult to find the answer.

legos.teaches: Infinitive clause (找到答案) precedes the predicate adjective (不难); no dummy subject it needed

seed_pair: 你为什么想停下来？
Why do you want to stop?

legos.teaches: question word 为什么 comes after subject in Chinese, not at start

seed_pair: 你在找什么？
What are you looking for?

legos.teaches: question word comes at end of clause in Chinese

seed_pair: 他不想整个下午照顾那只小狗。
He didn't want to look after the young dog all afternoon.

legos.teaches: negation 不 placed directly before verb
整个 (entire) + time word for duration expressions

seed_pair: 她不想告诉我它在哪里。
She didn't want to tell me where it was.

legos.teaches: verb + direct object order (告诉 + 我)
Mandarin Chinese uses subject + 在 + question word structure for location questions

seed_pair: 我们不想让任何人听到真相。
We didn't want to let anyone hear the truth.

legos.teaches: causative 让 structure with resultative complement 到 indicating successful perception

seed_pair: 我觉得你做得很好。
I think that you're doing very well.

legos.teaches: 觉得 introduces embedded clauses directly without needing a conjunction like that
得 (de) complement structure describes how an action is performed (verb + 得 + degree)

seed_pair: 非常感谢，但是我还有更多要学的。
Thank you very much, but I've got more to learn.

legos.teaches: Intensifier 非常 precedes the verb it modifies
Chinese uses 还有 (still have) + 要学的 (that needs learning) structure

seed_pair: 非常感谢你帮助我理解。
Thank you very much for helping me to understand.

legos.teaches: Intensifier 非常 precedes the verb it modifies
No preposition needed; verb directly takes object

seed_pair: 你还有更多要学的吗？
Have you got more to learn?

legos.teaches: Yes/no questions use 吗 particle at end; no word order change
的 nominalizes the verb phrase (thing that needs learning)
